guide.conclusion: This requires some simple sewing. I seriously had used my sewing machine maybe twice before making this. The onesie and hat were purchased at Target but really any onesie and knit hat would work. I had also planned on making the wings from card board and just painting them black but found these at JoAnn fabrics and they were just too perfect! The tail and wings detach so the baby can fit in the carseat.

guide.introduction: My wife has always made her own Halloween costumes from scratch and now that we have a 4 month old son he has joined in the tradition. This guide shows you how to make a cute dragon costume out of a child's onesie, polar fleece, and taffata.
guide.introduction_rendered:
My wife has always made her own Halloween costumes from scratch and now that we have a 4 month old son he has joined in the tradition. This guide shows you how to make a cute dragon costume out of a child's onesie, polar fleece, and taffata.

Relevant parts
  • Green child's onesie with green knit hat (any color will work), green and orange polar fleece fabric, orange taffeta fabric, interfacing, pair of child sized wings
Tools
  • Hot Glue gun & hot glue
  • Scissors
  • Singer traditional sewing machine
